TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebHttpBinding extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding implements class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IBindingRuntimePreferences
Public Class WebHttpBinding Inherits Binding Implements IBindingRuntimePreferences
type WebHttpBinding = class inherit Binding interface IBindingRuntimePreferences

Docs.summary: A binding used to configure endpoints for Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) Web services that are exposed through HTTP requests instead of SOAP messages.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WCF Web Programming Model allows developers to expose WCF Web services through HTTP requests that use "plain old XML" (POX) style messaging instead of SOAP-based messaging. For clients to communicate with a service using HTTP requests, an endpoint of the service must be configured with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> that has the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior> attached to it. The WCF Web Programming Model also requires that the individual service operations are annotated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> attributes. This defines a mapping from a URI and HTTP method to the service operation, as well as the format of the messages used to call the operation and return the results. Support in WCF for syndication and ASP.AJAX integration are both built on top of the WCF Web Programming Model.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default security mode is <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.None>, which specifies that no security is used.
To use transport-level security for endpoints configured with this binding, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.Transport> value must be specified as a parameter in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.
To use HTTP authentication without HTTPS, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.TransportCredentialOnly> value must be specified as a parameter in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.
The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> cannot be set again after the binding instance is created.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To use transport-level security for endpoints configured with this binding, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.Transport> value must be specified as a parameter in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.
To use HTTP authentication without HTTPS, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.TransportCredentialOnly> value must be specified as a parameter in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.
The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> cannot be set again after the binding instance is created.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowCookies { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowCookies : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the client accepts cookies and propagates them on future requests.
Docs.value: if cookies are allowed; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is provided as a convenience for using cookies included in HTTP headers. When cookies are accepted by the client by setting the property to `true`, cookies returned from the server are automatically copied to all future client requests to that service.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool BypassProxyOnLocal { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.BypassProxyOnLocal : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to bypass the proxy server for local addresses.
Docs.value: to bypass the proxy server for local addresses; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks An Internet resource is local if it has a local address. A local address is one that is on same computer, the local LAN or intranet, and is identified, syntactically, by the lack of a period (.), as in the URIs `http://webserver/` and `http://localhost/`.
Setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.BypassProxyOnLocal%2A> property determines whether endpoints configured with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> use the proxy server when accessing local resources.
If <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.BypassProxyOnLocal%2A> is `true`, requests to local Internet resources do not use the proxy server. When <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.BypassProxyOnLocal%2A> is `false`, all Internet requests are made through the proxy server.

Docs.summary: Returns an ordered collection of binding elements contained in the current binding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The order of the binding elements is important. It reflects the order in which the protocol and transport channels are constructed and stacked.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property long MaxBufferPoolSize { long get(); void set(long value); };
member this.MaxBufferPoolSize : int64 with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of memory allocated, in bytes, for the buffer manager that manages the buffers required by endpoints that use this binding.
Docs.value: The maximum size, in bytes, for the pool of buffers used by an endpoint configured with this binding. The default value is 65,536 bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> tries to minimize the cost of using buffers with a buffer pool. Buffers are required to process messages by the service when they come out of the channel. If there is not sufficient memory in the buffer pool to process the message load, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> must allocate additional memory from the CLR heap, which increases the garbage collection overhead. Extensive allocation from the CLR garbage heap is an indication that the buffer pool size is too small and that performance can be improved with a larger allocation by increasing the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.MaxBufferPoolSize%2A> limit.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxBufferSize { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxBufferSize : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of memory, in bytes, that is allocated for use by the manager of the message buffers that receive messages from the channel.
Docs.value: The maximum amount of memory, in bytes, available for use by the message buffer manager. The default value is 524,288 (0x80000) bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> minimizes the cost of using buffers by using a buffer pool. Buffers are required to process messages by the service when they come out of the channel. If there is not sufficient memory in the buffer pool to process the message load, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> must allocate additional memory from the CLR heap, which increases the garbage collection overhead. Extensive allocation from the CLR garbage heap is an indication that the buffer pool size is too small and that performance can be improved with a larger allocation by increasing the <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpBindingBase.MaxBufferPoolSize%2A> limit.

Docs.exception: The value set is less than or equal to zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property long MaxReceivedMessageSize { long get(); void set(long value); };
member this.MaxReceivedMessageSize : int64 with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size, in bytes, for a message that can be processed by the binding.
Docs.value: The maximum size, in bytes, for a message that is processed by the binding. The default value is 65,536 bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The size of the messages that can be received on the wire by services using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> is bounded by the amount of memory allocated for each message. This bound on message size is intended to limit exposure to denial of service (DoS) attacks.

Docs.exception: The value is less than zero.
A message exceeded the maximum size allocated.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Uri ^ ProxyAddress { Uri ^ get(); void set(Uri ^ value); };
member this.ProxyAddress : Uri with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URI address of the HTTP proxy.
Docs.value: A that serves as the address of the HTTP proxy. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.UseDefaultWebProxy%2A> is set to `true`, the value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.ProxyAddress%2A> is ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Xml::XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas ^ ReaderQuotas { System::Xml::XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas ^ get(); void set(System::Xml::XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas ^ value); };
member this.ReaderQuotas : System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets constraints on the complexity of SOAP messages that can be processed by endpoints configured with this binding.
Docs.value: The that specifies the complexity constraints.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The complexity constraints protect against a class of denial of service (DOS) attacks that attempt to use message complexity to tie up endpoint processing resources. The properties that express these constraints and their default values (in bytes) are as follows:
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxDepth%2A> = 32
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxStringContentLength%2A> = 8192
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxArrayLength%2A> = 16384
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxBytesPerRead%2A> = 4096
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxNameTableCharCount%2A> = 16384

Docs.exception: The quota values of are read only.
The quotas set must be positive.

Docs.summary: Gets the security settings used with this binding.
Docs.value: The that is used with this binding. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks To use a non-default type of security, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.
> [!NOTE] > If you set this property to <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.TransportCredentialOnly> and you are using HTTP, be aware that credentials are sent over the wire in plain text.
